result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin A. Hakes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Obtain GED or HSED at discretion of probation agent.
Complete letter of apology due within 30 days and approved by probation agent. Attend and participate in any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by probation agent.

timeConds.notes:
To begin no later than 4:30 p.m. on May 8, 2015.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Austin A. Hakes in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State motions to add an AKA to name of Austin A. Markowski. So ordered. Agreement placed on record by Atty. Tlusty. Advised of right to counsel. Waived at these proceedings. Court finds waiver given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently. DE entered a plea of no contest to the amended charge. Plea colloquy. Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty. Pursuant to the agreement, the Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for one year with the following conditions: 10 days county jail with huber to begin no later than 5-08-15 4:30 p.m., court costs, $200.00 DNA surcharge, letter of apology due within 30 days of sentencing approved by probation agent, no contact with T.S., counseling as deemed appropriate by probation agent, and obtain GED or HSED at discretion of agent. ap
Not on the record.  Defendant Austin A. Hakes in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Status conference on February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Austin A. Hakes in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of charges/penalties; of right to counsel. DE indicated he has contact SPD but does not qualify.  Court advised DE he may petition court for county assisted counsel; or retain his own counsel.  Advised of right to a timely preliminary hearing.  DE waived the time limit for a preliminary hearing.  PTC set.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  *Defendant shall have no contact with T.R.S. dob: 06-26-1991.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with T.R.S. dob: 06-26-1991.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Justin Wolff appeared specially.  Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $1,800.00 signature bond and a $200.00 cash bond with conditions of: Booking and no contact with T.R.S. dob: 06-26-1991.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Attorney Wolff requested that criminal complaint be filed in a timely matter.  DA responded it will be filed within 5 business days.  Initial appearance set for 12-02-2014 at 1:00 p.m.
